member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration
member.summary:
This class provides a base class for code-first, strongly typed configuration settings in .NET. It supports storing of configuration data in .NET .config files, plain XML files, strings and SQL Server databases and custom providers.
Using this class is easy: Create a subclass of AppConfiguration and then simply add properties to the class. Then instantiate the class, call Initialize(), then simply access the class properties to read configuration values.
The default implementation uses standard .NET configuration files and a custom section within that file to hold configuration values. Other providers can be used to store data to different stores and you can create your own custom providers to store configuration data in yet other stores. Managing Configuration Settings with AppConfiguration

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Provider
member.summary: An instance of a IConfigurationProvider that needs to be passed in via constructor or set explicitly to read and write from the configuration store.

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Contains an error message if a method returns false or the object fails to load the configuration data. Class AppConfiguration

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.InitializeCalled
member.summary: Internal flag that checks to see if Initialize was called if not - automatically calls it without parameters

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Initialize(Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.IConfigurationProvider,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method initializes the configuration object with a provider and performs an initial read from the config store.
member.param: Optional - preconfigured ConfigurationProvider instance. If not passed ConfigurationFileConfigurationProvider is used.
Optional - sub-section name used for config files. Not used by all config stores
Optional - additional config data to pass to OnInitialize if implemented

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.OnInitialize(Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.IConfigurationProvider,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Override this method to handle custom initialization tasks.
This method should: create a provider and call it's Read() method to populate the current instance of the configuration object.
If all you need is to create a default provider configuration use the OnCreateDefaultProvider() method to override instead. Use this method if you need to perform custom actions beyond provider instantiation.
member.param: Provider value - can be null in which case ConfigurationFileProvider is used
Sub Section name - can be null. Classname is used if null. Can be "appSettings"
Any additional configuration data that can be used to configure the provider.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.OnCreateDefaultProvider(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Override this method to use a specialized configuration provider for your config class when no explicit provider is passed to the Initialize() method.
member.param: Optional section name that was passed to Initialize()
Optional config data that was passed to Initialize()

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Write
member.summary: Writes the current configuration information data to the provider's configuration store.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.WriteAsString
member.summary: Writes the current configuration information to an XML string. String is in .NET XML Serialization format.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Read``1
member.summary: Reads the configuration information from the provider's store and returns a new instance of an configuration object.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Read
member.summary: Reads the configuration from the provider's store into the current object instance.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Read(System.String)
member.summary:
Reads configuration data from a string and populates the current instance with the values.
Data should be serialized in XML Searlization format created with
member.param: Xml string in XML Serialization format

member.summary: Reads configuration based on a provider configuration and returns a new instance of the configuration object
member.param: A configured provider
member.returns: instance of configuration or null on failure

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Read``1(System.String,Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.IConfigurationProvider)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the config object and retrieves configuration information from the provided string. String should be in XML Serialization format or created by the method.
member.param: Required if encryption decryption is desired
member.returns: config instance or null on failure

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration.Read``1(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the config object and retrieves configuration information from the provided string. String should be in XML Serialization format or created by the method.
member.returns: config instance or null on failure

member.summary: Sample class for diagram display

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.ConfigurationFileConfigurationProvider`1
member.summary: Reads and Writes configuration settings in .NET config files and sections. Allows reading and writing to default or external files and specification of the configuration section that settings are applied to.

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.ConfigurationProviderBase`1
member.summary:
Base Configuration Provider Implementation. This implementation provides for the basic layout of a provider and fields that implement the IConfigurationProvider interface.
The Read and Write methods must be overridden - all other methods and fields are optional

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.IConfigurationProvider
member.summary:
Configuration Provider interface that provides read and write services to various configuration storage mechanisms.
Used in conjunction with the class. A base implementation from which to inherit is provided in the class.

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1
member.summary:
Reads and Writes configuration settings in .NET config files and sections. Allows reading and writing to default or external files and specification of the configuration section that settings are applied to.
This implementation doesn't support Read and Write operation that don't return a string value. Only Read(string) and WriteAsString() should be used to read and write string values.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.Read``1
member.summary: Reads configuration data into a new instance from SQL Server that is returned.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.Read(Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration)
member.summary: Reads configuration data from Sql Server into an existing instance updating its fields.

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.ConnectionString
member.summary: The raw SQL connection string or connectionstrings name for the database connection.

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.ProviderName
member.summary: The data provider used to access the database

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.Tablename
member.summary: Table in the database that holds configuration data Table must have ID(int) and ConfigData (nText) fields

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.SqlServerConfigurationProvider`1.Key
member.summary:
The key of the record into which the config data is written. Defaults to 1.
If you need to read or write multiple different configuration records you have to change it on this provider before calling the Read()/Write() methods.

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.StringConfigurationProvider`1
member.summary:
Reads and Writes configuration settings from strings - which you manage yourself. Using strings for the configuration provider allows for easy storage into any non-supported configuration stores that you control through your code as long as it supports strings.
The string provider is a real minimal implementation that only implements WriteAsString(config) and Read(string). It inherits all of its functionality from the base provider.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.StringConfigurationProvider`1.Read``1
member.summary: Reads from the InitialStringData string data

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.StringConfigurationProvider`1.Read(Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration)
member.summary: Reads configuration information into config from InitialStringData

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.StringConfigurationProvider`1.Write(Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.AppConfiguration)
member.summary: Not supported for StringConfiguration

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils
member.summary: Utility library for common data operations.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyDataRow(System.Data.DataRow,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Copies the content of a data row to another. Runs through the target's fields and looks for fields of the same name in the source row. Structure must mathc or fields are skipped.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyObjectToDataRow(System.Data.DataRow,System.Object)
member.summary: Copies the content of an object to a DataRow with matching field names. Both properties and fields are copied. If a field copy fails due to a type mismatch copying continues but the method returns false

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyObjectData(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Copies the content of one object to another. The target object 'pulls' properties of the first.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyObjectData(System.Object,System.Object,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Copies the content of one object to another. The target object 'pulls' properties of the first.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyObjectData(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Copies the content of one object to another. The target object 'pulls' properties of the first.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.CopyObjectData(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary:
Copies the data of one object to another. The target object 'pulls' properties of the first. This any matching properties are written to the target.
The object copy is a shallow copy only. Any nested types will be copied as whole values rather than individual property assignments (ie. via assignment)
member.param: The source object to copy from
The object to copy to
A comma delimited list of properties that should not be copied
Reflection binding access

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.DataReaderToObjectList``1(System.Data.IDataReader,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo})
member.summary:
Creates a list of a given type from all the rows in a DataReader.
Note this method uses Reflection so this isn't a high performance operation, but it can be useful for generic data reader to entity conversions on the fly and with anonymous types.
member.param: An open DataReader that's in position to read
Optional - comma delimited list of fields that you don't want to update

Optional - Cached PropertyInfo dictionary that holds property info data for this object. Can be used for caching hte PropertyInfo structure for multiple operations to speed up translation. If not passed automatically created.
member.remarks: DataReader is not closed by this method. Make sure you call reader.close() afterwards

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.DataReaderToObject(System.Data.IDataReader,System.Object,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo})
member.summary:
Populates the properties of an object from a single DataReader row using Reflection by matching the DataReader fields to a public property on the object passed in. Unmatched properties are left unchanged.
You need to pass in a data reader located on the active row you want to serialize.
This routine works best for matching pure data entities and should be used only in low volume environments where retrieval speed is not critical due to its use of Reflection.
member.param: Instance of the DataReader to read data from. Should be located on the correct record (Read() should have been called on it before calling this method)
Instance of the object to populate properties on
Optional - A comma delimited list of object properties that should not be updated
Optional - Cached PropertyInfo dictionary that holds property info data for this object

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.MinimumSqlDate
member.summary: The default SQL date used by InitializeDataRowWithBlanks. Considered a blank date instead of null.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.DataUtils.InitializeDataRowWithBlanks(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Initializes a Datarow containing NULL values with 'empty' values instead. Empty values are: String - "" all number types - 0 or 0.00 DateTime - Value of MinimumSqlData (1/1/1900 by default); Boolean - false Binary values and timestamps are left alone
member.param: DataRow to be initialized

member.summary: Closes an active connection. If a transaction is pending the connection is held open.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.CreatePagingCommand(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Sql 2005 specific semi-generic paging routine

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.RunSqlScript(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Executes a long SQL script that contains batches (GO commands). This code breaks the script into individual commands and captures all execution errors.
If ContinueOnError is false, operations are run inside of a transaction and changes are rolled back. If true commands are accepted even if failures occur and are not rolled back.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.GetEntity(System.Object,System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.String)
member.summary: Generic routine to retrieve an object from a database record The object properties must match the database fields.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.GetEntity(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Generic routine to return an Entity that matches the field names of a table exactly.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.UpdateEntity(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates an entity object that has matching fields in the database for each public property. Kind of a poor man's quick entity update mechanism.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.SaveEntity(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves an enity into the database using insert or update as required. Requires a keyfield that exists on both the entity and the database.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Starts a new transaction on this connection/instance

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.CommitTransaction
member.summary: Commits all changes to the database and ends the transaction

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.RollbackTransaction
member.summary: Rolls back a transaction

member.summary: Sets the error message for the failure operations

member.summary: Sets the error message and error number.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.SetError
member.summary: Sets the error message for failure operations.

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.ErrorMessage
member.summary: An error message if a method fails

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.ErrorNumber
member.summary: Optional error number returned by failed SQL commands

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.Transaction

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.Connection
member.summary: The SQL Connection object used for connections

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Data.DataAccessBase.ExecuteWithSchema

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption
member.summary: A simple encryption class that can be used to two-way encode/decode strings and byte buffers with single method calls.

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.Key
member.summary: Replace this value with some unique key of your own Best set this in your App start up in a Static constructor

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.EncryptBytes(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a stream of bytes using DES encryption with a pass key. Lowest level method that handles all work.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.EncryptBytes(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts a string into bytes using DES encryption with a Passkey.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.EncryptString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts a string using Triple DES encryption with a two way encryption key.String is returned as Base64 encoded value rather than binary.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.DecryptBytes(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a Byte array from DES with an Encryption Key.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.DecryptString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a string using DES encryption and a pass key that was used for encryption. Class wwEncrypt

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.ComputeHash(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generates a hash for the given plain text value and returns a base64-encoded result. Before the hash is computed, a random salt is generated and appended to the plain text. This salt is stored at the end of the hash value, so it can be used later for hash verification.
member.param: Plaintext value to be hashed.
Name of the hash algorithm. Allowed values are: "MD5", "SHA1", "SHA256", "SHA384", and "SHA512" (if any other value is specified MD5 hashing algorithm will be used). This value is case-insensitive.
Salt bytes. This parameter can be null, in which case a random salt value will be generated.
member.returns: Hash value formatted as a base64-encoded string.
member.remarks: ComputeHash code provided as an example by Obviex at http://www.obviex.com/samples/hash.aspx As noted by Obviex themselves, code is definitely not optimally efficient. Should performance requirements necessitate improvement, this should be improved.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.GZipMemory(System.Byte[])
member.summary: GZip encodes a memory buffer to a compressed memory buffer

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.GZipMemory(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a string to a gzip compressed memory buffer

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.GZipMemory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encodes a file to a gzip memory buffer

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.Encryption.GZipFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encodes one file to another file that is gzip compressed. File is overwritten if it exists and not locked.

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.JsonSerializationUtils
member.summary: JSON Serialization helper class that uses JSON.NET. This class serializes JSON to and from string and files on disk.
member.remarks: JSON.NET is loaded dynamically at runtime to avoid hard linking the Newtonsoft.Json dll. Make sure that your project includes a reference to JSON.NET when using this class.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.JsonSerializationUtils.Serialize(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Serializes an object to an XML string. Unlike the other SerializeObject overloads this methods *returns a string* rather than a bool result!
member.param: Value to serialize
Determines if a failure throws or returns null
member.returns: null on error otherwise the Xml String.
member.remarks: If null is passed in null is also returned so you might want to check for null before calling this method.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.JsonSerializationUtils.SerializeToFile(System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Serializes an object instance to a JSON file.
member.param: the value to serialize
Full path to the file to write out with JSON.
Determines whether exceptions are thrown or false is returned
if true pretty-formats the JSON with line breaks

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.JsonSerializationUtils.DeserializeFromFile(System.String,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deserializes an object from file and returns a reference.
member.param: name of the file to serialize to
The Type of the object. Use typeof(yourobject class)
determines whether we use Xml or Binary serialization
determines whether failure will throw rather than return null on failure
member.returns: Instance of the deserialized object or null. Must be cast to your object type

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.JsonSerializationUtils.CreateJsonNet(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dynamically creates an instance of JSON.NET
member.param: If true throws exceptions otherwise returns null

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils
member.summary: Collection of Reflection and type conversion related utility functions

member.name: F:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.MemberAccess
member.summary: Binding Flags constant to be reused for all Reflection access methods.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetProperty(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a property value from an object dynamically. This is a simple version that uses Reflection calls directly. It doesn't support indexers.
member.param: Object to make the call on
Property to retrieve

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetField(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a field dynamically from an object. This is a simple implementation that's straight Reflection and doesn't support indexers.
member.param: Object to retreve Field from
name of the field to retrieve

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyInternal(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Parses Properties and Fields including Array and Collection references. Used internally for the 'Ex' Reflection methods.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyInternal(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Parses Properties and Fields including Array and Collection references.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a property or field value using a base object and sub members including . syntax. For example, you can access: oCustomer.oData.Company with (this,"oCustomer.oData.Company") This method also supports indexers in the Property value such as: Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
member.param: Parent object to 'start' parsing from. Typically this will be the Page.
The property to retrieve. Example: 'Customer.Entity.Company'

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyInfoInternal(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a PropertyInfo structure from an extended Property reference

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetProperty(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the property on an object. This is a simple method that uses straight Reflection and doesn't support indexers.
member.param: Object to set property on
Name of the property to set
value to set it to

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetField(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the field on an object. This is a simple method that uses straight Reflection and doesn't support indexers.
member.param: Object to set property on
Name of the field to set
value to set it to

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a value on an object. Supports . syntax for named properties (ie. Customer.Entity.Company) as well as indexers.
member.param: Object to set the property on.
Property to set. Can be an object hierarchy with . syntax and can include indexers. Examples: Customer.Entity.Company, Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
Value to set the property to

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.CallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Type[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a method on an object dynamically. This version requires explicit specification of the parameter type signatures.
member.param: Instance of object to call method on
The method to call as a stringToTypedValue
Specify each of the types for each parameter passed. You can also pass null, but you may get errors for ambiguous methods signatures when null parameters are passed
any variable number of parameters.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.CallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Calls a method on an object dynamically.
This version doesn't require specific parameter signatures to be passed. Instead parameter types are inferred based on types passed. Note that if you pass a null parameter, type inferrance cannot occur and if overloads exist the call may fail. if so use the more detailed overload of this method.
member.param: Instance of object to call method on
The method to call as a stringToTypedValue
Specify each of the types for each parameter passed. You can also pass null, but you may get errors for ambiguous methods signatures when null parameters are passed
any variable number of parameters.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.CallMethodEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a method on an object with extended . syntax (object: this Method: Entity.CalculateOrderTotal)

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.CreateInstanceFromType(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates an instance from a type by calling the parameterless constructor.
Note this will not work with COM objects - continue to use the Activator.CreateInstance for COM objects. Class wwUtils
member.param: The type from which to create an instance.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.CreateInstanceFromString(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of a type based on a string. Assumes that the type's

member.summary: Helper routine that looks up a type name and tries to retrieve the full type reference in the actively executing assemblies.

member.summary: Creates a COM instance from a ProgID. Loads either Exe or DLL servers.

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.TypedValueToString(System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a type to string if possible. This method supports an optional culture generically on any value. It calls the ToString() method on common types and uses a type converter on all other objects if available
member.param: The Value or Object to convert to a string
Culture for numeric and DateTime values
Return string for unsupported types

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.ReflectionUtils.StringToTypedValue(System.String,System.Type,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary:
Turns a string into a typed value generically. Explicitly assigns common types and falls back on using type converters for unhandled types.
Common uses: * UI -> to data conversions * Parsers Class ReflectionUtils
member.param: The string to convert from
The type to convert to
Culture used for numeric and datetime values.
member.returns: object. Throws exception if it cannot be converted.

member.summary: Generic version allow for automatic type conversion without the explicit type parameter

Tries to create a phrase string from CamelCase text. Will place spaces before capitalized letters.
Note that this method may not work for round tripping ToCamelCase calls, since ToCamelCase strips more characters than just spaces.

member.summary: Strips any common white space from all lines of text that have the same common white space text. Effectively removes common code indentation from code blocks for example so you can get a left aligned code snippet.

member.summary: UrlDecodes a string without requiring System.Web

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.StringUtils.GetUrlEncodedKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a value by key from a UrlEncoded string.
member.param: UrlEncoded String
Key to retrieve value for
member.returns: returns the value or "" if the key is not found or the value is blank

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.StringUtils.SetUrlEncodedKey(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Allows setting of a value in a UrlEncoded string. If the key doesn't exist a new one is set, if it exists it's replaced with the new value.
member.param: A UrlEncoded string of key value pairs

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.StringUtils.Base36Encode(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Encodes an integer into a string by mapping to alpha and digits (36 chars) chars are embedded as lower case
Example: 4zx12ss

member.name: M:Westwind.Utilities.StringUtils.Base36Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a base36 encoded string to an integer

member.name: T:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.JsonFileConfigurationProvider`1
member.summary: Reads and Writes configuration settings in .NET config files and sections. Allows reading and writing to default or external files and specification of the configuration section that settings are applied to.

member.summary: Write configuration to XmlConfigurationFile location

member.name: P:Westwind.Utilities.Configuration.JsonFileConfigurationProvider`1.JsonConfigurationFile
member.summary: Optional - the Configuration file where configuration settings are stored in. If not specified uses the default Configuration Manager and its default store.
